item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Death wins nothing here, gnawing wings that amputate–– then spread, lift up, fly." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Shine your soul with the same egoless humility as the rainbow and no matter where you go in this world or the next, love will find you, attend you, and bless you." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by W.E.B. Du Bois
item.description: "Eastward and westward storms are breaking,--great, ugly whirlwinds of hatred and blood and cruelty. I will not believe them inevitable." -- W.E.B. Du Bois

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Terri Windling
item.description: "Our lives are our mythic journeys, and our happy endings are still to be won." -- Terri Windling

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Stars ink your fingers with a lexicon of flame blazing rare knowledge." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "In an age of bombs guzzling blood, skylarks merge peace with thought and action." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "We are living in an era in which billions of people are grappling to promote communication, tolerance, and understanding over the more destructive forces of war, terrorism, and political chaos that have characterized the beginning of the 21st Century." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "The dancing vortex of a sacred metaphor clashes horns and halos to make wounded music set to the tempo of a new era in brilliant labor." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "This world’s anguish is no different from the love we insist on holding back." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "In your hands winter is a book with cloud pages that snow pearls of love." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Journey through the Power of the Rainbow represents a condensed compendium of literary efforts from a life dedicated to transforming the themes of injustice, grief, and despair that we all encounter during some unavoidable point of our existence into a sustainable life-affirming poetics of passionate creativity, empowered spiritual vision, and inspired commitment." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Some have speculated that the way [Albert] Camus died made his theories on absurdity a self-fulfilling prophecy. Others would say it was the triumphant meaningful way he lived that allowed him to rise heroically above absurdity." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "There is in Albert Camus’ literary craftsmanship a seductive intelligence that could almost make a reader dismiss his philosophical intentions if he had not insisted on making them so clear." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Before the thunderous clamor of political debate or war set loose in the world, love insisted on its promise for the possibility of human unity: between men and women, between blacks and whites, northerners and southerners, haves and have-have-nots, self and self." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "The ecstatic beauty and soulful grace of Rumi’s poetry inspires human hearts to believe in possibilities beyond the predictably fatal." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s dream was a manifestation of hope that humanity might one day get out of its own way by finding the courage to realize that love and nonviolence are not indicators of weakness but gifts of significant strength." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Authentic inspiration endows individuals with mental or spiritual energy which they are then able to transform into positive action. It can make all the difference between a man, woman, or child allowing despair to permanently paralyze any dreams they may have for their lives, or, exercising sufficient strength of will to make those dreams a reality." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "There may be more beautiful times, but this one is ours." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Terri Windling
item.description: "The simple truth is that being a creative artist takes courage; it’s not a job for the faint of heart. It takes courage each and every time you put a book or poem or painting before the public, because it is, in fact, enormously revealing." -- Terri Windling

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by John Myhill
item.description: "No non-poetic account of reality can be complete." -- John Myhill

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Now come the whispers bearing bouquets of moonbeams and sunlight tremblings." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "A poet is a verb that blossoms light in gardens of dawn, or sometimes midnight." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Rosy Cole
item.description: "Nature is bent on new beginning and death has not a chance of winning..." -- Rosy Cole

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Poetry looking in the mirror sees art, and art looking in a mirror sings poetry." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "The whole purpose of the construction of The Bridge of Silver Wings was to provide a path leading to The River of Winged Dreams, or to serve as a resting place until the river’s deeper and truer nature revealed itself." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by David Bedrick
item.description: "A love-based psychology views social prejudice as impacting people's well-being, and the promotion of social justice as an important psychological intervention." -- David Bedrick

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "If it wasn’t for all those silver wings spread out to help you on your journey, you would’a been dead or someplace screamin’ in a nut house a long time ago." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Aberjhani add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "This rose of pearl-coated infinity transforms the diseased slums of a broken heart into a palace made of psalms and gold." -- Aberjhani
